poem:
Title: Of Dice and Duty

A lonely soldier, 
His life wrapped in uniforms
Finds steel-jawed beast, with blinking eyes,
Echoes Seoul's frenzied life,
In a hotel's shadowed corner.

His heart, quick as dice toss,
emulates their capricious dance.
Tokens spill, adrenaline rushes,
An unspoken war unfurls.

Unseen enemy in a slot machine,
A combat concealed within his palms.
In victory's silence, a sergeant's defeat found.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
